intro: Sphaeranthus cylindraceus, commonly known as the cylindrical sphaeranthus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a dense, spherical cluster, giving it its common name. Sphaeranthus cylindraceus is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
